sn44.4:4.1: At one time Venerable Sāriputta and Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita were staying near Benares, in the deer park at Isipatana. …
sn44.4:4.3: “What’s the cause, reverend, what’s the reason why this has not been declared by the Buddha?”
sn44.4:4.4: “Reverend, not truly knowing and seeing form, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation, one thinks ‘a Realized One exists after death’ or
sn44.4:4.5: ‘a Realized One doesn’t exist after death’ or
sn44.4:4.6: ‘a Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death’ or
sn44.4:4.7: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’
sn44.4:4.8: Not truly knowing or seeing feeling …
sn44.4:4.11: consciousness, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation, one thinks ‘a Realized One exists after death’ or
sn44.4:4.12: ‘a Realized One doesn’t exist after death’ or
sn44.4:4.13: ‘a Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death’ or
sn44.4:4.14: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’
sn44.4:5.6: consciousness, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation, one doesn’t think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ or
sn44.4:5.7: ‘a Realized One doesn’t exist after death’ or
sn44.4:5.8: ‘a Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death’ or
sn44.4:5.9: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’
sn44.4:5.10: This is the cause, this is the reason why this has not been declared by the Buddha.”
